message.content: This question requires knowledge about the behavior of monitor lizards and their thermoregulation. Monitor lizards are ectothermic animals, meaning they rely on external sources of heat to regulate their body temperature. Option (D) is correct because if a monitor lizard leaves a rainy forest and moves to a sunny desert, the increased exposure to sunlight and higher ambient temperature will cause its body temperature to increase. Option (A) is incorrect because going into a hole underground would provide shade and cooler temperatures, causing the lizard's body temperature to decrease. Option (B) is also incorrect because hiding under a tree may provide partial shade but not enough heat to increase body temperature. Option (C) is incorrect because swimming in a fountain may provide some temporary cooling but will not lead to an overall increase in body temperature.

This question requires some basic knowledge about the behavior of monitor lizards and how they regulate their body temperature. Monitor lizards are ectothermic animals, meaning they rely on external sources of heat to regulate their body temperature. Option (D) states that the lizard leaves a rainy forest for a sunny desert, which implies that it is moving from a cooler to a hotter environment. In the sunny desert, the lizard will be exposed to more direct sunlight and higher ambient temperatures, causing its body temperature to increase. 

Options (A), (B), and (C) all describe situations where the lizard may seek shelter or water, but they do not directly involve an increase in temperature. In option (A), going into a hole underground may provide the lizard with a cooler environment. In option (B), hiding under a tree may provide shade, which can help lower the lizard's body temperature. In option (C), swimming in a fountain may provide a source of water but is unlikely to significantly affect the lizard's body temperature.

This question requires some basic understanding of how reptiles regulate their body temperature. Reptiles are ectothermic, meaning they rely on external sources of heat to regulate their body temperature. In this case, if a monitor lizard leaves a rainy forest (which could provide cooler temperatures) for a sunny desert, it will have access to higher temperatures from the sun. This increase in temperature will cause the lizard's body temperature to increase. Options (A), (B), and (C) are incorrect because they do not directly involve an increase in external temperature.
